STATES</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="5" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:18.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SECURITIES
AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Washington, D.C. 20549</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="5" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:18.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Form&nbsp;6-K</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:bold;">REPORT OF
FOREIGN PRIVATE ISSUER PURSUANT TO RULE 13a-16 OR 15d-16 UNDER THE<br>
SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">For the month of July, 2010.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Commission File Number</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="5" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:18.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGNICO-EAGLE MINES LIMITED</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Translation
of registrant&#146;s name into English)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">145
King Street East, Suite&nbsp;400, Toronto, Ontario M5C 2Y7</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Address
of principal executive office)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant files
or will file annual reports under cover of Form&nbsp;20-F or Form&nbsp;40-F. <br>
Form&nbsp;20-F&nbsp;</font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">x</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Form&nbsp;40-F&nbsp;</font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indicate by check mark if
the registrant is submitting the Form&nbsp;6-K in paper as permitted by
Regulation S-T Rule&nbsp;101 (b)( 1):&nbsp;</font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note: </font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Regulation S-T Rule&nbsp;101 (b)( 1) only permits the submission in
paper of a Form&nbsp;6-K if submitted solely to provide an attached annual
report to security holders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indicate by check mark if
the registrant is submitting the Form&nbsp;6-K in paper as permitted by
Regulation S-T Rule&nbsp;101 (b)(7):&nbsp;</font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note: </font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Regulation S-T Rule&nbsp;101(b)(7)&nbsp;only permits the submission in
paper of a Form&nbsp;6-K if submitted to furnish a report or other document
that the registrant foreign private issuer must furnish and make public under
the laws of the jurisdiction in which the registrant is incorporated, domiciled
or legally organized (the registrant&#146;s &#147;home country&#148;), or under the rules&nbsp;of
the home country exchange on which the registrant&#146;s securities are traded, as
long as the report or other document is not a press release, is not required to
be and has not been distributed to the registrant&#146;s security holders, and, if
discussing a material event, has already been the subject of a Form&nbsp;6-K
submission or other Commission filing on EDGAR.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant by
furnishing the information contained in this Form&nbsp;is also thereby
furnishing the information to the Commission pursuant to Rule&nbsp;12g3-2(b)&nbsp;under
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Yes&nbsp;</font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No&nbsp;</font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">x</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If &#147;Yes&#148; is marked,
indicate below the file number assigned to the registrant in connection with Rule&nbsp;12g3-2(b):
82-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.</font></p>

<head>

<body lang="EN-US">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exhibit 1</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="494" height="75" src="g149081ka01i001.jpg"></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="59%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:59.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Stock Symbol:</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  <b>AEM (NYSE and TSX)</b></font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="40%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">For further information:</font></b></p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="59%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:59.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="40%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Investor Relations</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="59%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:59.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="40%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(416) 947-1212</font></b></p>

 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(All
amounts expressed in U.S. dollars unless otherwise noted)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGNICO-EAGLE REPORTS Q2 2010 RESULTS;<br>
RECORD QUARTERLY REVENUE, NET INCOME AND GOLD PRODUCTION</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Toronto
(July&nbsp;28, 2010) &#151; Agnico-Eagle Mines Limited</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(&#147;Agnico-Eagle&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;) today reported a record
quarterly net income of $100.4 million, or $0.64 per share, for the second
quarter of 2010.&#160; This result includes a
non-cash foreign currency translation gain of $17.4 million, or $0.11 per
share, as well as a one-time tax recovery of $21.2 million, or $0.14 per
share.&#160; The result also includes non-cash
stock-based compensation expense of $8.1 million, or $0.05 per share.&#160; In the second quarter of 2009, the Company
reported net income of $1.2 million, or $0.01 per share.&#160; A 116% increase in gold production and a 151%
increase in gross mine profit over the second quarter of 2009 contributed to the
record financial and operating quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Second quarter 2010 cash provided by
operating activities was $161.6 million (including an increase in working
capital of $16.7 million), up from cash provided by operating activities of
$26.4 million in the second quarter of 2009 (which included a decrease in
working capital of $27.4 million).&#160; This
significant increase was largely due to gold production that was more than
double that in the comparable period in 2009 and substantially higher prices
for gold, zinc, silver and copper.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Our record quarterly financial
results were driven by record gold production as all six of our mines operated
throughout the quarter for the first time.&#160;
Four of the mines are now operating at steady state with the other two
in the late stages of optimization&#148; said Sean Boyd, Vice-Chairman and Chief
Executive Officer.&#160; &#147;Further increases in
gold production and lower cash operating costs are expected in the second half
of 2010 as we continue to optimize all our mines and focus on driving down the
unit costs at our Kittila and Meadowbank mines&#148; added Mr.&nbsp;Boyd.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Second quarter 2010 highlights
include:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Record Gold Production,</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  <b>Record</b>  <b>Revenue and Record Net Earnings </b>&#151; quarterly gold production
of 257,728 ounces resulted in revenue of $353.9 million and net earnings of
$100.4 million</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Good Cost Control Continues at Steady State
Mines </font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151; minesite costs per tonne
continue to be on target at; LaRonde, Goldex, Lapa and Pinos Altos.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Improved Available Liquidity </font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151; during the quarter the Company executed a new
non-amortizing, unsecured $1.2 billion revolving credit facility through a
syndicate of banks.&#160; The Company also
issued $600 million of unsecured long-term notes which was used to reduce
amounts outstanding under the credit facilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Payable gold production(1)&nbsp;in
the second quarter of 2010 was a record 257,728 ounces at total cash costs per
ounce(2)&nbsp;of $487.&#160; This compares
with payable gold production of 119,053 ounces at total cash costs per ounce of
$326 in the second quarter of 2009.&nbsp; The increase in total cash costs per ounce
in the second quarter of 2010 is mainly due to the high costs at Meadowbank
($663/oz) as the mine moves through start-up and commissioning.&#160; Total cash costs are expected to decline as
the mining and processing rate increases and gold output grows towards steady
state levels.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the first six months of 2010,
payable gold production was a record 445,960 ounces at total cash costs per
ounce of $469.&#160; This compares with
payable gold production of 210,864 ounces at total cash costs per ounce of $320
in the first half of 2009.&nbsp; The increase in gold production is due to the
impact of four new gold mines commencing operations in the past 14 months.&#160; The increase in total cash costs per ounce in
the first half of 2010 is mainly due to the high costs at Meadowbank ($695/oz)
as stated above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the full year 2010, gold
production is still expected to be in line with previous guidance of between
1.0 and 1.1 million ounces.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total cash cost per ounce guidance
of $399 was provided on December&nbsp;16, 2009.&#160;
This was based on projected gold production of 1.057 million ounces and
the following assumptions:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Applying current spot rates for
these factors would result in total cash cost estimates of approximately $420
per ounce.&#160; Based on the higher operating
costs experienced at Kittila and Meadowbank during the commissioning phase in
2010,&#160; the Company expects that its full
year total cash cost per ounce is likely to be in the range of $425 to $450.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Second
Quarter 2010 Results Conference Call Webcast</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s senior management will host a <u>conference call on Thursday, July&nbsp;29, 2010</u> at <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">11:00
AM (E.D.T.)</u></b> to discuss financial results and provide an
update of the Company&#146;s exploration and development activities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Via Webcast:</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
live audio webcast of the meeting will be available on the Company&#146;s website
homepage&nbsp;at <b><i style="font-weight:bold;">www.agnico-eagle.com.</i></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&nbsp; Payable production of a
mineral means the quantity of mineral produced during a period contained in
products that are sold by the Company, whether such products are shipped during
the period or held as inventory at the end of the period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&nbsp; Total cash costs per ounce
is a non-GAAP measure.&#160; For
reconciliation of this measure to production costs, as reported in the
financial statements, see Note 1 to the financial statements at the end of this
press release.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For
those preferring to listen by telephone, please dial </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">416-644-3415 or toll-free 877-974-0445.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To ensure your participation, please call
approximately five minutes prior to the scheduled start of the call.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Replay archive:</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Please dial 416-640-1917 or
toll-free 877-289-8525, passcode 4328627#.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
conference call replay will expire on Thursday, August&nbsp;5, 2010</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
webcast along with presentation slides will be archived for 180 days<b><i style="font-weight:bold;">  </i></b>on the website.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">New SVP
Finance, Chief Financial Officer</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company is pleased to announce that Mr.&nbsp;Ammar Al-Joundi will be joining
Agnico-Eagle as of September&nbsp;1, 2010 in the position of SVP Finance and
Chief Financial Officer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Al-Joundi
has over 20 years of experience in finance on both the corporate and banking
sides.&#160; Most recently Mr.&nbsp;Al-Joundi
was with Barrick Gold Corporation where he had spent the previous 11 years in
progressively more senior roles including: VP Treasurer then SVP Finance for
Barrick Gold Corporation; Executive Director and CFO for Barrick South America;
and finally SVP Capital Allocation and Business Strategy for Barrick Gold
Corporation.</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Al-Joundi
is a graduate of the University of Toronto in Mechanical Engineering and has a
MBA from the University of Western Ontario.&#160;
Ammar is also a Professional Engineer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash Position
Remains Strong &#151; Credit Facility Restructuring Provides Additional Liquidity</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash and cash equivalents increased
to $152.8 million at June&nbsp;30, 2010 from the March&nbsp;31, 2010 balance of
$118.1 million.&nbsp; The large increase in gold production and its associated
effect on revenues, net income and cash flows were mainly responsible for the
increase.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Capital expenditures in the second
quarter of 2010 were $117.0 million, including $33.9 million at Meadowbank,
$28.2 million at Pinos Altos, $22.8 million at LaRonde, $16.6 million at Kittila,
$10.6 million at Lapa and $4.7 million at Goldex.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For 2010, capital expenditures are
estimated at $500 million, up from a previous estimate of $478 million.&#160; The additional capital is being spent at
Meadowbank and Kittila to make improvements to the process plants and
accelerate the purchase of mining equipment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With its cash balances, anticipated
cash flows, available bank lines and increased debt capacity, Agnico-Eagle
remains fully funded for the development and exploration of its current
pipeline of gold projects in Canada, Finland, Mexico and the USA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the second quarter of 2010, the Company executed an amended non-amortizing,
unsecured $1.2 billion revolving credit facility, maturing June&nbsp;2014. This
facility replaces both pre-existing unsecured tranches of the Company&#146;s credit
lines.&#160; The new facility is being
provided by a syndicate of international banks.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3<a name="PB_3_215953_5796"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Available credit lines under the
amended facility as of June&nbsp;30, 2010 were more than $1.0 billion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LaRonde Mine &#151; Steady State Mine Continues
Strong Performance</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
100% owned LaRonde mine in northwestern Quebec, Canada, began operation in
1988.&#160; Proven and probable gold reserves
at LaRonde total approximately 4.8 million ounces from 34.4 million tonnes
grading 4.4 grams per tonne (&#147;g/t&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The LaRonde mill processed an
average of 7,254 tonnes per day (&#147;tpd&#148;) of ore in the second quarter of 2010,
compared with an average of 7,212 tpd in the corresponding period of 2009.&#160; LaRonde has been operating at a steady state
of approximately 7,000 tpd for approximately seven years, since its most recent
expansion in 2003.</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minesite costs per tonne(3)&nbsp;were
C$79 in the second quarter of 2010, compared to C$74 in the second quarter of
2009.&#160; The rise in minesite costs was
largely due to a higher proportion of expensed versus capitalized underground
development during the second quarter of 2010.&#160;
Typically stope development is expensed while permanent development is
capitalized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the first half of 2010, minesite
costs per tonne were on budget at C$75 as the higher proportion of expensed
development in the second quarter of 2010 balanced out the lower proportion in
the first quarter of 2010.&#160; For the first
half of 2009, the minesite costs per tonne were C$73.&#160; The increase is largely due to general cost
inflation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net of byproduct credits, LaRonde&#146;s
total cash costs per ounce were $270 in the second quarter on production of
41,533 ounces of gold.&#160; During the second
quarter of 2009, total cash costs per ounce were $109 on production of 58,034
ounces of gold.&#160; The increase in total
cash costs is largely due to the lower gold production.&#160; This lower production was due to an expected
decrease in gold grade for stopes mined in 2010.&#160; Additionally, an unfavourable swing in the
CAD/USD exchange rate during the period had the effect of increasing total cash
costs.&#160; Somewhat offsetting these factors
were higher byproduct metals revenues.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the first six months of 2010,
LaRonde&#146;s total cash costs per ounce were $216 on gold production of 86,569
ounces, as compared to the first half of 2009, when the total cash costs per
ounce were $196<i>  </i>on<i>  </i>production
of 109,372 ounces of gold.&#160; The higher
total cash costs were largely due to the lower gold production and stronger
Canadian dollar, partly offset by higher byproduct metals revenues, as above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Commencing in late 2011, when the
Company expects to begin mining ore from the LaRonde Extension, LaRonde is
expected to begin producing more gold, averaging 324,000 ounces of gold per
year through 2023, reflecting the higher gold grades at depth, where the
deposit remains open.&#160; The development of
the LaRonde Extension remains on time and on budget.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&nbsp; Minesite costs per tonne
is a non-GAAP measure.&#160; For
reconciliation of this measure to production costs, as reported in the
financial statements, see Note 1 to the financial statements at the end of this
news release.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4<a name="PB_4_220028_2897"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Goldex &#151; Strong Production and Cost Control
Continue</font></b></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 100% owned Goldex mine in
northwestern Quebec began operation in 2008.&#160;
Proven and probable gold reserves total 1.6 million ounces from 24.7
million tonnes grading 2.0 g/t.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Goldex mill processed an average
of 7,327 tpd in the second quarter of 2010, continuing to exceed the 2010 mine
plan of approximately 6,900 tpd.&#160; During
the second quarter of 2009, the plant processed 6,875 tpd.&#160; Minesite costs per tonne at Goldex were
approximately C$24 in the second quarter of 2010, in line with the C$24 per tonne
achieved in the second quarter of 2009.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Payable gold production in the
second quarter of 2010 was 48,334 ounces at total cash costs per ounce of
$324.&#160; This compares favourably to the
second quarter of 2009 when gold production was 35,645 ounces at total cash
costs per ounce of $365.&#160; The higher
ounce output is largely due to the resumption of mining from the higher grade
portions of the orebody.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the six month period ended June&nbsp;30,
2010, total cash costs at Goldex were $348 per ounce on gold production of
90,603 ounces.&#160; Total cash costs per
ounce during the comparable six month period in 2009 were $352 on gold
production of 71,604 ounces.&#160; The
improvement in production and costs continues to reflect optimization of
recoveries and throughput at the Goldex mine.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Life of mine average annual gold
production is expected to be approximately 168,000 ounces per year through
2017.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
expansion of the mine from 6,900 tpd to 8,000 tpd was approved in 2009.&#160; An&#160;
increase in the mining rate has been realized earlier than anticipated
as development of the orebody is ahead of schedule.&#160; Goldex should be able to achieve the higher
rate on a steady state basis in the fourth quarter of 2010 with only minor
modifications to the mill to support the higher throughput.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With Goldex operating at
steady-state, and the final production blast for the current orebody scheduled
for late 2010 (to be followed by approximately seven years of extraction), the
focus has shifted to exploration and potentially extending the mine life by
adding nearby zones, such as the &#147;M&#148;, &#147;E&#148; and &#147;S&#148; zones, into the mine plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Additionally, Agnico-Eagle recently
entered a purchase and option agreement to explore Adventure Gold Inc.&#146;s
Dubuisson project located immediately west of Goldex.&#160; Up to $4 million is expected to be spent on
this property over a period of five years from the effective date of the
agreement.&#160; If Agnico-Eagle exercises its
options, the Company may acquire up to 70% of Dubuisson.</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Lapa &#151;
Strong Tonnage and Cost Performance Continue</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 100% owned Lapa mine in
northwestern Quebec achieved commercial production in May&nbsp;2009.&#160; Proven and probable gold reserves total
approximately 0.8 million ounces from 3.2 million tonnes grading 8.2 g/t.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5<a name="PB_5_220102_3020"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Lapa circuit, located at the LaRonde mill, processed an average of 1,523 tpd,
compared to 895 tpd in the partial second quarter of 2009.&#160; This throughput is slightly higher than the
design rate for the mill of 1,500 tpd and reflects results of continued
optimization efforts at the mill.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minesite
costs per tonne were C$118 in the second quarter of 2010, well below the C$149
incurred in the second quarter of 2009.&#160;
This reduction in cost reflects the optimization and efficiencies which
have been realized since the May&nbsp;2009 start-up.&#160; Specifically, mine personnel have been
successful in increasing the throughput to offset the higher dilution
underground.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Payable
production in the second quarter of 2010 was 28,927 ounces of gold at total
cash costs per ounce of $545. This compares to 11,603 ounces of gold at total
cash costs per ounce of $948 during the partial second quarter of 2009.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the six month period ending June&nbsp;30,
2010, total cash costs at Lapa were $516 per ounce on gold production of 60,480
ounces.&#160; This compares with gold
production of 11,603 ounces at total cash costs of $948 in the partial first
half of 2009.&#160; This production increase
and unit cost decrease is largely due to improved throughput and its associated
efficiencies.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Life of mine production is expected
to be approximately 115,000 ounces of gold through 2015.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">An
underground exploration program to the east and to the west of the Contact zone
has begun.&#160; The goal is to transfer
additional resource into reserves and to further test the favourable Cadillac
Break gold belt, especially to the east.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Kittila &#151; Mill Optimization Beginning to Show
Results</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 100% owned Kittila mine in
northern Finland achieved commercial production in May&nbsp;2009.&#160; Proven and probable gold reserves total
approximately 4.0 million ounces from 26.0 million tonnes grading 4.8 g/t.</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Kittila mill processed an
average of 2,412 tpd in the second quarter of 2010, compared to 1,980 tpd in
the second quarter of 2009.&#160; While
getting closer to the design rate of 3,000 tpd, the throughput in the second
quarter of 2010 was negatively affected by a longer than expected scheduled
maintenance shutdown in the processing plant in the first quarter (which lasted
until April&nbsp;10), as well as maintenance work on the oxidation scrubber for
three days in June.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Gold recoveries in the second
quarter of 2010 averaged approximately 68%, down from the 71% achieved in the
first quarter of 2010.&#160; The lower
recoveries were largely due to a series of process changes that were implemented
in the second quarter of 2010.&#160; However,
these changes are expected to lead to improving recoveries over the next
several quarters as further optimization is undertaken in the plant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Recoveries have improved
significantly over the past several weeks largely due to the control and
reduction of the chloride compound levels in the autoclave.&#160; Since the implementation of the chlorine
reduction process, recoveries have averaged 74% in June&nbsp;and the average </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6<a name="PB_6_220148_7748"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">has exceeded 81% during the 40-day
period ending July&nbsp;27.&#160; The design
rate of 83% mill recovery is expected to be achieved on a steady state basis by
the end of 2010.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minesite costs per tonne at Kittila
were approximately &#128;64 in the second quarter, in line with the &#128;64 achieved in
the first quarter of 2010.&#160; In the second
quarter of 2009 (partial quarter as the mine was declared commercial in May),
minesite costs per tonne averaged &#128;43.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The increase in minesite costs is
largely due to the increased use of contractors and autoclave repairs.&#160; Due to limited equipment availability,
additional contract labour was required in both operations and
maintenance.&#160; The autoclave repairs,
which carried over into the second quarter of 2010, reduced this quarter&#146;s mill
availability to 78% (down 7% from the first quarter).&#160; In 2011, minesite costs per tonne are
expected to fall as throughput increases in the plant and as optimization of
the mine continues.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Second quarter 2010 gold production
at Kittila was 31,593 ounces at total cash costs per ounce of $607, compared to
13,771 ounces at cash costs per ounce of $658 in the partial second quarter of
2009.&#160; Approximately half of the second
quarter 2010 gold production was realized in June, reflecting the greatly
improved milling performance.</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the six month period ending June&nbsp;30,
2010, total cash costs at Kittila were $663 per ounce on gold production of
56,140 ounces.&#160; This compares with gold
production of 18,285 ounces at total cash costs of $658 in the partial first
half of 2009.&#160; This production increase
is largely due to higher mill recoveries and improved throughput.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total cash costs per ounce are
expected to decline as gold output increases in the second half of 2010 due to
the increased processing rate and improved recoveries.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second quarter, the first
underground stopes were mined.&#160; Total
underground production is expected to account for approximately 10% of Kittila&#146;s
2010 production.&#160; Dilution levels, to
date, have been better than expected.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Life of mine average gold production
is expected to be approximately 150,000 ounces per year through 2032.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
study is underway examining the possibility of increasing the production rate
at Kittila reflecting the continued growth of the reserve base.&#160; Following the successful optimization of the
mill recoveries, and further drilling at depth and to the north of the main
Suuri deposit, it is anticipated that the expansion study will be completed by
the middle of 2011.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Pinos Altos &#151; Ramp-up Continues with Improved
Results.&#160; Additional Filter Capacity
Expected in Q3</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 100% owned Pinos Altos mine in
northern Mexico achieved commercial production in November&nbsp;2009.&#160; Proven and probable reserves, including the
stand-alone Creston Mascota deposit, total 3.4 million ounces of gold and 94
million ounces of silver from 42.0 million tonnes of ore grading 2.5 g/t of
gold and 69 g/t silver.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Pinos Altos mill processed an average of 3,575 tpd in the second quarter of
2010, representing a significant improvement over the prior quarter (2,584 tpd)
as the ramp up to </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7<a name="PB_7_220223_141"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the
design rate of 4,000 tpd continues.&#160;&#160;
Additional tailings filtration capacity is expected to be installed
during the third quarter of 2010 which should enable a proposed increase in
throughput.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minesite
costs per tonne were below budget at $31 in the second quarter of 2010,
compared to $34 in the prior quarter.&#160; No
comparable period exists in 2009 as the mine achieved commercial production in
November.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
first underground mining blocks were extracted as expected in the second
quarter of 2010.&#160; A 13,000 tonne
underground stope was extracted which confirmed the block model in terms of
grade and dilution.&#160;&#160; The paste backfill
system has been commissioned and is fully operational.</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Payable
production in the second quarter of 2010 was 29,665 ounces of gold at total
cash costs per ounce of $415. This compares favourably with the prior quarter
which had payable gold production of 26,228 ounces at total cash costs per
ounce of $436 (there is no comparable second quarter or six month period in
2009 as the mine achieved commercial production in November).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For
the first six months of 2010, payable gold production was 55, 893 ounces at
total cash costs of $425 per ounce.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Life of mine average gold production
is expected to be approximately 170,000 ounces per year through 2028, including
production from Creston Mascota.&#160; Over
this period, annual silver production is expected to average 2.5 million
ounces.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Civil
works and mechanical construction activities have commenced at the nearby,
stand-alone, Creston Mascota project which is expected to achieve commercial
production in the second quarter of 2011.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Further
exploration is underway and the Company is anticipating the eventual
development of several other satellite deposits on the Pinos Altos concession
package which could include the Sinter, Cubiro and San Eligio zones.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Meadowbank
&#151; Tonnage Ramp-Up Continues</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
100% owned Meadowbank mine project in Nunavut, Canada, achieved commercial
production in March&nbsp;2010.&#160; Proven
and probable gold reserves total 3.7 million ounces from 32.2 million tonnes
grading 3.5 g/t.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second quarter of 2010,
the Meadowbank mill processed an average of 6,262 tpd, with several days in June&nbsp;exceeding
9,000 tpd.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">However, since the February&nbsp;start-up,
unit costs have been negatively impacted by harder ore, less than optimal
fragmentation from the pit and a different particle size gradation from the
crusher than expected.&#160; To solve these
issues the Company is installing a permanent secondary crushing unit in the
front end of the circuit, similar to the solution adopted at Goldex.&#160; However, this has negatively impacted both
capital (as previously discussed) and operating cost estimates for the mine in
2010.&#160; This secondary crusher should be
installed </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8<a name="PB_8_220306_7608"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and be operational in the first half
of 2011.&#160; In the meantime, a portable
crushing unit is being used.</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minesite costs per tonne were higher
than planned at C$94 in the second quarter of 2010, due to the increased costs
associated with; the replacement of some major components, the installation and
use of a portable crusher, logistics, and additional use of contractors.&#160; A portable crusher was installed in the
second quarter which is expected to help facilitate higher throughput and lower
minesite costs per tonne in the second half of 2010.&#160; Longer term it is anticipated that a
permanent crusher will be added.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Payable production during the second
quarter of 2010 was 77,676 ounces of gold, at total cash costs per ounce of
$663.&#160; During March&nbsp;2010, gold
production was 18,599 ounces at total cash costs of $840 per ounce. The total
cash costs are also expected to decline during the remainder of 2010 as the
mine and mill operations are optimized and gold production increases.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Gold production in 2010 is expected
to be approximately 300,000 ounces.&#160; Life
of mine average annual gold production is expected to be approximately 350,000
ounces through 2019.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
study examining the possibility of increasing the production rate at Meadowbank
is partially complete.&#160; The study was
scheduled to be completed in 2010.&#160;
However, due to ongoing optimization efforts, the study is being delayed
until the mine reaches steady state and further underground drilling is
completed.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Meliadine Acquisition Complete, Exploration
Program Begins</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subsequent to quarter end, on July&nbsp;7,
2010, Agnico-Eagle completed the acquisition of 100% of the Meliadine gold
property (through the acquisition of Comaplex Minerals Corp.), located
approximately 300 kilometres southeast of the Company&#146;s Meadowbank mine.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Meliadine currently hosts 3.3
million ounces of gold in measured and indicated resources (12.9 million tonnes
grading 7.9 g/t) plus 1.7 million ounces of gold in inferred resources (8.4
tonnes grading 6.4 g/t).&#160; The deposit
remains open for expansion and a large scale exploration program has been
approved and is underway.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Through early 2013, it is
anticipated that approximately $62 million will be spent on drilling
approximately 200,000 metres with the main focus being on converting the
resource at the high grade Tiriganiaq zone to reserves.&#160; An underground bulk sample will also be
completed along with a feasibility study, permitting and road
construction.&#160; The total expenditures
over this period are expected to be approximately $130 million.</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Initial results from this drilling
program, and those for Agnico-Eagle&#146;s other exploration programs, will be
presented in an exploration update planned for September&nbsp;2010.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Corporate Social Responsibility Report
Published</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the quarter, Agnico-Eagle
published its first Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) report.&#160; The CSR report details the Company&#146;s
economic, health, safety, environment and social performance from January&nbsp;1
to December&nbsp;31, 2009.&#160; It is
intended to give </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9<a name="PB_9_220335_8146"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">shareholders, employees,
contractors, suppliers, business partners, government bodies and people in the
communities in which the Company operates a better understanding of how
Agnico-Eagle manages operational safety, environmental and social risks.&#160; The report is available on the Company&#146;s
website at:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">http://www.agnico-eagle.com/Theme/Agnico2/files/AEM_CSR_2010_Final.pdf</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">About Agnico-Eagle</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Agnico-Eagle is a long established,
Canadian headquartered, gold producer with operations located in Canada,
Finland and Mexico, and exploration and development activities in Canada,
Finland, Mexico and the United States.&#160;
Agnico-Eagle&#146;s LaRonde mine is Canada&#146;s largest operating gold mine in
terms of reserves.&#160; The Company has full
exposure to higher gold prices consistent with its policy of no forward gold
sales.&#160; It has paid a cash dividend for
28 consecutive years.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10<a name="PB_10_220345_7091"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\105576\10-14908-1\task4207340\14908-1-ka-01.htm',USER='105576',CD='Jul 30 02:52 2010' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGNICO-EAGLE
MINES LIMITED</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SUMMARY OF
OPERATIONS KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(thousands
of United&nbsp;States dollars, except where noted, US GAAP basis, Unaudited)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 1</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Gross mine profit is calculated as total revenues from all metals, by
mine, minus total production costs, by mine.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 2</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Meadowbank achieved commercial production as of March&nbsp;1,
2010.&#160; Payable production includes
commercial production of 95,191 ounces since March&nbsp;1, 2010 and
non-commercial production of 1,084 ounces.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 3</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total cash costs per ounce of gold is calculated net of silver, copper,
zinc and other byproduct credits. The weighted average total cash cost per
ounce is based on commercial production ounces.&#160;
Total cash costs per ounce is a non-GAAP measure.&#160; For a reconciliation to production costs, see
Note 1 to the financial statements.&#160; See
also &#147;Note Regarding Certain Measures of Performance&#148;.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12<a name="PB_12_230013_2897"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGNICO-EAGLE
MINES LIMITED</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONSOLIDATED
STATEMENTS OF INCOME</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(thousands
of United States dollars except share and per share amounts, US GAAP basis)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Unaudited)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="45%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:45.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGNICO-EAGLE
MINES LIMITED</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONSOLIDATED
STATEMENTS OF CASH FLOWS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(thousands
of United States dollars, US GAAP basis)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Unaudited)</font></b></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 1&#160; </font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
tables provide a reconciliation, on an individual mine basis, of the total cash
costs per ounce of gold produced and minesite costs per tonne to production
costs as set out the interim consolidated financial statements:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Total Cash Costs per Ounce of Gold By Mine</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="39%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:39.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(thousands of dollars, except where<br>
  noted)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Three months<br>
  ended<br>
  June&nbsp;30, 2010</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Three months<br>
  ended<br>
  June&nbsp;30, 2009</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">

  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.0%;">

  ended<br>
  June&nbsp;30, 2009</font></b></p>

  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">425</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minesite cost per tonne (EUR) (iv)</font></p>
